avalancheActivity.comment: The new residual precipitation (snow mixed with rain up to 2000 m) will increase and overload the significant layer of recent snow that has not yet consolidated; the threat rating will remain 4 Strong. Triggering will be possible with low overload on many steep slopes at all aspects. To the south the whole recent snow cover rests, almost entirely, on unfrozen uncovered ground, a condition that will favor it accentuated snow flow phenomena. Numerous natural avalanches both on the ground and on the ground will be possible surface, large and very large in size.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Residual weak rainfall, waning during the morning. Snow level between 1800 and 2000 metres. New accumulations expected around 5 cm in the Eastern Prealps, lower elsewhere.

snowpackStructure.comment: From a snowological point of view, the situation will always have to be carefully evaluated, especially in alpine terrain (beyond treeline), and in the central-southern sectors due to rising temperatures. In detail: on the Rhaetian sectors and Adamello the trend in the degree of danger will gradually decrease, going from 4 strong to 3 marked. Problems windy snow above 2300 m, with the presence of extensive soft accumulations, fragilely anchored to the basal layers. About Orobie e Prealpi the avalanche danger level will remain 4 strong. This will be due to the greater accumulations of new snow, compared to northern band, and to the temperature trend, which will determine, in the last tail of the disturbance, rain up to 1800-2000 m (with relative moistening and weakening of the snow). The mild temperatures and the persistence of cloud cover will hinder night-time freezing, further weighing down the snow cover. These sectors will be widely affected by neviflow phenomena (downhill sliding of the entire thickness of the mantle, commonly known as "glide").

avalancheActivity.comment: The new weak snowfall will increase the recent widespread accumulations which will present a weak consolidation on many steep slopes. The triggering will be possible even with a low overload, generating very large avalanches. Numerous large spontaneous releases will be possible on steep slopes not yet released.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Residual weak rainfall, waning during the morning. Snow level between 1800 and 2000 metres. New accumulations of a few centimeters.

avalancheActivity.comment: The phases of snow mixed with rain will weigh down the snowpack, resting on unfrozen exposed ground. On the steep slopes at higher altitudes, releases and spontaneous releases of medium and large ground avalanches will be possible.

avalancheActivity.comment: Thin layers of snow resting on uncovered ground. Possible discharges of small and medium size on steep slopes at higher altitudes.
